meanings.definition: A secondary panel within a larger electrical panel.
meanings.sent1: The electrician installed the subpanels to manage the power distribution.
meanings.sent2: The subpanels in the breaker box control different sections of the house.
meanings.sent3: When the main panel threw a party, the subpanels decided to have their own gathering.
meanings.sent4: The subpanels were like little siblings, always following the main panel's lead.
meanings.sent5: The subpanels hummed quietly, each playing its part in the electrical system.

meanings.definition: Panels that are subordinate to a main panel.
meanings.sent1: The subpanels were neatly arranged beneath the primary panel.
meanings.sent2: In the control room, the subpanels displayed important information for the operators.
meanings.sent3: The main panel felt important with the subpanels dutifully carrying out their tasks.
meanings.sent4: The subpanels worked harmoniously together, supporting the main panel's functions.
meanings.sent5: Each of the subpanels had a specific role in the overall system.
